result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:41 AM Defendant Mercedes Deanna Pennington in custody at Taycheedah Correctional Institution.  Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court for Mercedes Deanna Pennington.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah Dodge appears on behalf of ADA Robert J Jambois for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are 20CF444, 21CF208, 22CF87 (Arraignment) & 22CF132 (Arraignment).

Atty McFarland states that this will be an adjournment.
Court questions the defendant.

10:42 a.m.  Court calls the cases.
ADA Dodge states the appearances.
ADA Dodge states that the defendant has new significant charges against her and these cases will need to be adjourned.
Atty McFarland states that there is a conflict for him on the new charges and did inform the public defender's office for new counsel to be appointed.
Both parties are requesting that these case be expedited so that the defendant can get her programming done while she is incarcerated. 

BY THE COURT: 
Cases to be adjourned to track with her new charges on 10/03/22 @ 2:15 p.m.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

1:09 PM Defendant Mercedes Deanna Pennington appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Taylor Soule appears in Court on behalf of Defendant.
Cases heard are 22CF-87, 22CF-132, 20CF-444 and 21CF-208.

Court calls cases.
Atty Pfeil states appearances.

This is an appearance on outstanding warrants.

BY THE COURT:
Court quashes warrants on all files.

Atty Pfeil addresses the Court as to bond, requests additional $1000 cash bond with same prior conditions imposed, making it $250 on each file.
Atty Soule requests signature bonds. Defendant is on a PO hold and will be sitting for some time. Defendant states she is also in drug court.

Court reviews the files.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders $1,000 cash bond to cover all, $250 on each.
Any terms and conditions to still apply.

22CF-87 and 22CF-132: Preliminary hearing set for July 18th at 3 pm.

11:12 AM Prosecuting attorney Robert J Jambois appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Mercedes Deanna Pennington appeared by video, in custody from the Portage County jail, Attorney Erik John Mcfarland for Mercedes Deanna Pennington appeared in court. 

All files heard: 22CF87, 22CF132, 21CF208, 20CF444

22CF87 - Initial appearance held:
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.
Preliminary hearing set for 5/2 at 3:00 p.m. 

Atty Jambois states they anticipate to resolve all the cases and prelims to be waived or will be dismissed and read-in with other plea agreements.  SHe is on probation and facing revocation in other counties and may be referred to drug court as an alternative to revocation. 
Atty mcFarland is in agreement with that. 

BY THE COURT: Preliminary hearings will be set for a date after the 25 so the parties can discuss the files before that date.

Defendant appears from jail by video.

Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond.
